Position OverviewDetails of the role and how it fits into the teamAs Analytics Senior Analyst you will be a member of our Data Analytics Center of Excellence (CoE) for Group Audit. You will pioneer and support Group Audit in implementing innovative and effective analytics processes that are critical to the success of our audit function. Based in the Madrid office, you will work embedded in audit teams around the world, applying the latest analytics technologies while connecting with the central team in Germany to leverage our core analytics solutions. You will be responsible for supporting all Group Audit functions with data analytics services and audit automation solutions.ResponsibilitiesEvaluate and provide analytics solutions to auditors to identify potential risk, anomalies, detect outliers and identify weaknesses in control activities using analytical tools like SQL and Python.Collaborate closely with auditors, data owner and subject matter experts to understand business requirement and translate them into analytical solution in an agile and iterative manner.Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders including Senior Management that support informed decision-making process and effectively drive business strategy.Proactively identify automation opportunities and develop solutions that simplify audit processes and make Group Audit more efficient.Drive innovation across Group Audit, leveraging the experience gained and data collected from successful data analytics projects.SkillsMaster’s or bachelor’s degree (or equivalent – PhD appreciated) from an accredited college or university (or equivalent) in a quantitative field (Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, etc.) or equivalent work experience with at least 5 years of relevant experience.Proficiency in SQL and Python for data analysis as well as in reporting and visualization with hands-on experience in ETL and datawarehouse, Hadoop, Hive/Impala as well as familiarity with GCP services and tools, OpenShift, CDSW,Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey complex information in clear and concise manner to Senior Management, Audit committees and other stakeholder.Strong problem-solving and analytical skill to interpret complex data and derive actionable insights.A creative technologist passionate about data and information with an intrinsic motivation and curious to learn new technologies and frameworks to adopt data analytics for new ways of auditing.Well-being & BenefitsA healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. Emotionally and mentally balanced: We support you in dealing with life crises, maintaining stability through illness, and maintaining good mental health. Benefit from initiatives such as counseling and support in difficult life situations and a culture where you can openly speak about mental health.Physically thriving: We support you managing your physical health by taking appropriate preventive measures and providing a workplace that helps you thrive. For example, discount in gyms, annual medical check up's, standing desks, ...Socially connected: We strongly believe in collaboration, inclusion and feeling connected to open up new perspectives and strengthen our self confidence and well being. Benefits vary from different types of paid and unpaid leave, hybrid model of remote working (for some positions …)Financially secure: We support you to meet personal financial goals during your active career and for the future. Benefit from meal allowance, pension contribution plans, banking services for employees, flex compensation program...We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

Job Description / CapsuleThe Senior Data Analyst will direct the preparation of data-driven insights for business decision makers to help develop business intelligence, optimize effectiveness and/or predict business outcomes. The role will drive the analysis of data to support the process they are enabling through the identification, analysis and interpretation of trends or patterns and prepare ongoing reports and data visualizations to aid in complex data storytelling. The role may coordinate the creation, maintenance and/or improvement of exploratory and predictive analytics statistical models for ongoing and ad hoc review and analysis of data. The role will work autonomously with limited direct supervision from senior team members. Will provide coaching, task management and support to Data Analyst promoting best practice across multiple domains, and/orstakeholder groups.Typical Accountabilities Implementation of Analytical Solutions: Coordinate the implementation of analytical and data visualization solutions to interrogate datasets for insights within project scope. Solutions may utilize tools like Python, PowerBI, and cloud- based platforms. These solutions may also involve exploratory and predictive analytics models.Design prototypes and build functional designs for reporting and visualization.Hands-on use of PowerBI for developing dashboards and prototypes Project Management Perspective on Data and Analytics: Apply a strong understanding of project management principles to ensure timely delivery of data solutions aligned with business objectives. Data Modeling: Lead the creation of conceptual and logical data models to support analytics initiatives and ensure dataintegrity. Data Products and Standardization: Drive the creation and implementation of data products in alignment with the organization’s data strategy. Promote standardization and best practices to ensure alignment with organizational goals. Change Management: Act as a catalyst for change within the organization, promoting and embedding a culture of data-driven decision-making. Facilitate the transition to standardized, strategic approaches to data and analytics. Serve as an advocate for data governance and quality assurance practices. Data Requirements: Collaborate with business users to define data requirements and translate unstructured business problems into structured data designs and solutions. Data Wrangling: Conduct ad hoc sourcing, extraction, profiling, and integration of data to support omnichannel campaigns, advanced analytics, and Data Science model generation. CRM and ERP Data Models: Apply knowledge of CRM and ERP data models to ensure solutions align with organizational data structures and processes, facilitating seamless integration and analysis. Analytics Problem Solving: Coordinate the translation of business problems into analytics questions, propose solutions,and deliver actionable insights. Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain effective relationships with stakeholders, ensuring clear communication of results, uncertainties, and limitations. Advanced Analytics: Provide expertise in exploratory, descriptive, and predictive data analytics as a first level to shape solutions that drive business value in collaboration with data scientist. Visualization Development: Create innovative visualizations and tools to support complex analytical solutions. Innovation and Trends: Stay updated on trends, methodologies, and developments in analytics to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Global and Local Data & Reporting Ecosystems: Liaise with global digital and data and reporting teams on projects related to global data ecosystems and act as a bridge between global and local teams. Adoption and Training: Drive adoption of available tools with stakeholders and provide training to collaborators on optimal use of key data and analytics tools. Regulatory and Data Governance Compliance: Develop, implement, and maintain tools and solutions that meet regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, industry-specific directives). Ensure alignment with data governance practices and organizational policies.Typical People Management Responsibility (direct / indirect reports)Approximate number of people managed in total (all levels) 0Matrix Manager – (projects/dotted line)Manager of a teamGrandfather (manager of a manager)What is the global remit? (how many countries will the role operate in?) Operates in:Own country XAnother country2 or 3 countries at a minimum of 40% of time4 or more countries at a minimum of 40% of timeRemit which covers all AstraZeneca countriesEssentialEducation, Qualifications, Skills and Experience Bachelors Degree in relevant discipline or equivalentyears of experience Strong project management experience in data andanalytics contexts. Experience in life sciences and healthcare Hands-on expertise with PowerBI, including thedevelopment of prototypes and functional designs. Knowledge of functional and technical design principles. Proven experience in driving change management andacting as a data and analytics ambassador. Working experience with web analytics and mediaanalytics is required Demonstrated knowledge of database systems (eg SQL,NoSQL, graph) and ML programming language suchPython and R. Experience using Adobe Analytics/Google Analytics, GTM Demonstrated experience in the complex analysis ofdata in applied business and/or scientific applicationdomains Excellent written and verbal communication, businessanalysis, and consultancy skills Advanced ability to draw conclusions from data andpresent in a succinct fashion to stakeholders Knowledge of Customer Data Platforms (ie: Teallium,SFData Cloud, Treasure Data, …) Knowledge of Marketing Activation tools and its datamodel (Adobe Campaign, Twilio, Sengrid, …) Knowledge of GDPR and other data privacy regulations,as well as familiarity with data governance frameworks.Desirable Comfortable working in high performance computing or cloud environment Working experience with Python or RKey Relationships to reach solutionsInternal (to AZ or team) IDS internal team Business Excellence, CustomerEngagement and Digital, Learning and Innovation. About Clarity AI 🪴Clarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 with a unique mission: bringing societal impact to markets.We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide top international investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions. We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate and curious individuals from all over the world, with offices in New York, Madrid, London, Paris, and Abu Dhabi. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech AI company backed by investors and strategic partners such as BlackRock, SoftBank, and Deutsche Börse, who believe in us and share our goals. We are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment, and we take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible. We have plans to continue growing our teams globally, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! Your work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of investors, companies and consumers worldwide.About The Role 💻We are looking for a DART Data Analyst Intern to join our Product Specialist Squad’s Data Access Request Team (“DART") that will help us deliver an excellent experience to our prospects and clients across our different modules. More specifically, the DART team is dedicated to providing high-quality and efficient data extractions and day-to-day data insights to support our clients in their understanding and evaluation of sustainability aspects of their investments, such as metrics that measure ESG, climate, and impact of corporations. As a data-driven company, Clarity aggregates millions of data points from entities such as governments and companies and validates, synthesizes, and transforms these to provide comparable and actionable conclusions to our clients. DART helps our clients to understand what data is applicable to them and how we can support their sustainability goals.The role provides an opportunity to working with large amounts of data and extracting insights.What You’ll Be Doing 🚀Working as a DART Data Analyst Intern, you will be responsible for:Working on Ad hoc data extraction, analysis, and dataset preparationConverting raw data into client-ready formats by creating Excel files, dashboards, or reportsDeveloping templates and standards for data extraction and synthesisIdentifying and resolving inconsistencies or data gaps with autonomy and ownership by working with internal teams such as Product, Tech, or ResearchAssisting in developing internal tools to ensure high data quality and make data more accessible to internal usersInteracting with salespeople, Product Specialists, and Client Success Managers to solve complex data-based client questionsLocation 🌍The role is based in MadridWay of Working: Remote / HybridRequirementsWhat You’ll Need 👀Years of experience: 0-1Educational Background: Bachelors or Masters degree in a technical or data related field (e.g. engineering, mathematics … )Experience developing with PythonData analysis experience using SQLGood quantitative skillsExperience with BI and Data warehousesEager to learn in a collaborative team environmentStrong communication skills and empathy to solve internal customer requests (ad-hoc data analysis, data platform support, etc)Curious about understanding data structures and the insights that can be derived from itProactive in solving data challengesFluency in English (C1)Authorized and eligible to work in the EU Able to do an internship agreement with your schoolAble to work as a full-time employee - minimum of 5 to 6 monthsSelf-starter, able to take ownership and initiative, with high energy and staminaNice To Have ✨Experience in a start-upInterest in sustainability metrics.Experience with financial data automatic testingBachelor's degree or higher, in a financial discipline such as Banking, Finance, Investment Management, or Sustainable Finance.What we offer 🥁Flexibility in terms of schedules and location, whether you prefer to work from home, the office, or abroad with access to a global network of co-working spacesAnnual training budget to support your professional growthRegular team activities and eventsMore About Clarity AI ⭐Clarity AI’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognised by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40.The leadership team has an international presence and is composed of professionals from leading tech, consulting, and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.Clarity AI has received several awards: The Forrester New Wave - ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics - Leaders for 2022-2024 Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca MinguelaClarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

titulo_oferta: Oliver Wyman Digital: Data & Analytics - Analyst/ Senior Analyst - Madrid (Spain)
descripcion: WHO WE ARE:Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.We are looking for Analysts and Senior Analysts to pursue a career in quantitative analytics. Working with us offers excellent career and growth opportunities for highly motivated individuals with relevant education in a quantitative subject.WHAT YOU WILL DO:As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges.Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas.Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.Notable projects include:Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more informationModelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banksOptimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkitValidating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bankDeveloping probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banksIdentifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more informationDeveloping a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom companyWHY JOIN USExpect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!Immediate impact, continuous challenge  You'll work on challenging projects that have a significant impact on clients, industries, and societies from day one.We’ll ask you to be brave, challenging the status quo and constantly striving to build something new to shape our firm and the world around us. You’ll be a contributing team member from the start, building trust-based relationships with stakeholders and delivering breakthrough impact.  Your learning curve will be steep, with each project offering new opportunities to expand your toolkit and to team with specialists who have deep subject-matter and technical expertise. You’ll likely have the chance to travel within your home market and internationally. No two weeks are ever the same.  Click here to learn even more.Chart your course; we support the journey You’ll have the opportunity to work on projects across all our industries and capabilities and will be able to specialize early or leave it until several years in.  Various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career, including a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and your talent manager.  We care deeply about sustainable work-life quality and provide for career flexibility with a variety of programs including sabbaticals, non-profit fellowships, and externships.  We hire you to be youOur open, inclusive, and down-to-earth culture will enable you to bring your best authentic self to work. You’ll work alongside down-to-earth colleagues who do serious work, but don’t take themselves too seriously. There’s no corporate mold to fit and hierarchy doesn’t get in the way. We do not let artificial barriers stand in the way of your personal career progression. WHO CAN APPLY?Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleaguesIdeally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologiesStrong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environmentExcellent command of English and Spanish (verbal and written)Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plusHOW TO APPLY?Please submit your CV, cover letter and transcripts. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter.  Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers. R_283005

We believe in people and the value they bring to our organization, that is why we are proud to have a company culture focused on people and for the people.LEARNING AND DEVELOPMENTIn constant improvement! Our employees are the engine that makes Keyrus work every day, and those who make the difference in the projects we develop constantly receive training in the most cutting-edge technologies.WORK ENVIRONMENT Good vibes only! We have a diverse, inclusive and pleasant environment. Teamwork, good environment, and company events we organize throughout the year to nurture and continually improve the company-employee relationship.INNOVATIONWe want to change the world! Innovation runs in our DNA, and we want our future co-workers to have that passion, commitment, enthusiasm and cooperative spirit that is part of our essence.Social BenefitsOur strategy to change and improve our world begins through different social initiatives promoted by our Human Resources department such as flexible hours, family conciliation, and competitive remuneration packages at market level.

Gi Group es la multinacional Italiana líder en el mundo que ofrece soluciones integrales para el desarrollo del mercado laboral. Nuestra misión es contribuir con una visión global al desarrollo del mercado laboral con el objetivo principal de aumentar la empleabilidad, basándonos siempre en el valor personal y social del trabajo. Trabajamos día a día con nuestros candidatos y trabajadores para guiarles en su carrera profesional, y con nuestros clientes, para lograr un crecimiento y consecución de éxitos conjunta.Conoce más en https://es.gigroup.com/Desde Gi Group buscamos incorporar un/a BI-Data Engineer para realizar una sustitución en una importante empresa de Telecomunicaciones ubicada en la zona de las Tablas, Madrid.La labor del equipo de BI incluye varias responsabilidades clave, todas centradas en el manejo integral del dato desde su origen hasta su explotación final. Comenzando con la administración de data warehouse corporativo basado en Snowflake. Esto implica no solo mantener la base de datos, sino también optimizarla para consultas eficientes, garantizar la seguridad de los datos y supervisar la integración de nuevas fuentes de datos.Como data engineers dentro de nuestro equipo somos responsables de la integración y captación de nuevas fuentes de datos, así como su proceso de ETL/ELT hasta nuestro data warehouse. Para ello, nos basamos en las herramientas dentro del entorno Cloud de Azure. Principalmente con Databricks y Datafactory. Databricks está basada en Apache Spark y nos permite realizar análisis de datos avanzados y ser los dueños de nuestros propios procesos de ingesta. Por otro lado, Azure Data Factory nos permite automatizar y orquestar el flujo de datos desde varias fuentes, transformarlos según sea necesario, y cargarlos en Snowflake para su posterior análisis y visualización en Power BI.Con respecto a Power BI, nos encargamos de desarrollar dashboards y reportes que permiten a la empresa tomar decisiones informadas.La gobernanza de datos es otra área crítica de nuestra responsabilidad. Nuestra misión es establecer y mantener políticas y procedimientos que rigen el uso adecuado de los datos dentro de la empresa. Esto incluye asegurar la calidad de los datos, su confidencialidad, integridad y disponibilidad.¿Cómo será tu día a día?Tu rol implicará involucrarte activamente en la creación integral de soluciones de ingeniería de datos, comenzando por comprender el problema y los objetivos comerciales hasta llegar al desarrollo de modelo de datos completamente funcionales. Siendo responsable desde la integración de las fuentes de datos hasta la explotación dentro del datawarehouse, mediante Spark en Databricks y SQL en Snowflake.Todo esto dentro un equipo multidisciplinar con gran capacidad técnica en el que contarás con la oportunidad de emplear una gama extensa de tecnologías de vanguardia para el diseño de sistemas de administración de datos, utilizando diferentes enfoques de procesamiento y modelado.Tu día a día:Integración de nuevas fuentes de datos.Creación de nuevas pipeline de datos.Creación de flujos automáticos para la captación y transformación de datos.Diseño de explotación de datos en DW.Modelado de nuevos casos de uso.Y para ello, creemos que sería ideal que contaras con…Experiencia:Experiencia desempeñando labores como Data Engineer, enfocado en la implementación y puesta en marcha de soluciones para la captura y transformación de datos.Experiencia en el uso de herramientas en entornos locales como en la nube, específicamente en entornos Azure.Formación:Ingeniería Informática, de Telecomunicaciones, Formación Profesional o experiencia profesional equivalente.Cursos formativos basados en el stack tecnológico que manejamos Spark,Snowflake Azure.Conocimientos técnicos:Python y/o Spark: nivel medio-alto.SQL y/o PL/SQL: nivel medio.Buenas dotes de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.Se valorará experiencia en herramientas como Snowflake, Databricks o Azure Data Factory.Para desempeñar el rol, las skills que encajarían con el equipo y el proyecto serían:Habilidades de organización y comunicación. Orientación al Cliente.Capacidad para establecer relaciones de confianza con los Clientes y para mantener el control en situaciones de estrés.Sentido de urgencia.Capacidad de síntesis y ejecutiva.Gestión y Liderazgo de Equipos para conseguir la entrega de servicios y su eficiencia.

En FLAT 101 seguimos creciendo y ampliamos nuestro departamento de Digital Analytics.Trabajarás con dedicación 100% a un gran proyecto del sector bancario debiendo asistir a sus oficinas una vez por semana.Si eres un/una “DATA enthusiast” que disfruta con los retos y desafíos seguramente te interesa lo que te vamos a contar a continuación.¿Qué es Flat 101?Flat 101 es la empresa española de referencia en optimización (CRO/CXO/BXO), diseño y desarrollo de productos y servicios digitales. Prestamos servicios de alto rendimiento digital orientados a solucionar los problemas de hoy para conseguir los resultados del mañana.Nuestro objetivo es revolucionar los productos, servicios y negocios digitales con elegancia y calidad. Y todo ello con un método de trabajo propio contrastado en base a años de trabajo.¿Cuál será tu día a día?Configurarás soluciones de analítica en Tealium iQ principalmente y apoyado en otras plataformas como Firebase Analytics o GTM Server Side, colaborando con equipos de desarrollo.Realizarás la validación en la medición para garantizar la correcta implementación de etiquetados en app y web utilizando Charles Proxy.Elaborarás las guías de etiquetado, depurarás errores en código JavaScript o frameworks SPA (Angular/React), y proporcionarás soporte técnico a los equipos responsables.Requisitos:¿Qué buscamos?Buscamos una persona con capacidad de comunicación, proactiva y trato a cliente, con capacidad de proponer acciones en base a los datos observados de manera autónoma.Te encargarás del plan de medición, etiquetado, validación en diferentes entornos, todo orientado a app¿Qué necesitamos?Un analista de datos con experiencia en las herramientas y procesos que listamos a continuación: GA4, GTM, Charles Proxy, Tealium IQ.Experiencia en creación de planes de medición e implementación de analítica digitalExperiencia en el análisis de datos en contexto de negocio: interpretación de métricas para extraer información que sea útil para la generación de acciones de mejora.Residencia en Madrid y disponibilidad para asistir un día a la oficina.¿Por qué nosotros y no otros? Esto podemos ofrecerte en Flat 101:Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido desde el primer día.Formato de trabajo híbrido asistiendo a las oficinas del Banco ubicadas Madrid. La asistencia inicial a la oficina será de 2 días por semana (los primeros 2-3 meses), tras un primer periodo de adaptación se podrá asistir a la oficina 1 vez por semana de manera habitual.Horario propio del Banco: 9h a 18h (1h para comer) de L-J los viernes horario intensivo de 8h a 15h.27 días laborables de vacaciones al año.Presupuesto anual para tu formación profesional y asistencia a eventos.Formar parte de un equipo referente en analítica digital, diseño de productos y servicios digitales y CRO con amplia experiencia en el sector y en continuo crecimiento.Una filosofía de trabajo basada en poner cariño a los proyectos y honestidad en nuestras relaciones profesionales. No somos una factoría, y no queremos serlo.Trabajar en proyectos a nivel nacional e internacional.Continuo aprendizaje, en base a plan de mejora y carrera personalizado con evaluación anual.Acceso a formación especializada diseñada exclusivamente para Flat 101: programas de formación internos, workshops y dinámicas de equipo.Visibilidad profesionalMagnífico ambiente de trabajo.Eventos internos periódicos para aprender y compartir experiencias.Entorno laboral inclusivo y diverso. Somos una empresa que cree en la ética y en la responsabilidad en sus proyectos.Perks (beneficios): posibilidad de contratar seguro médico integral a través de retribución flexible (desde Flat tenemos un acuerdo muy beneficioso con Adeslas), flexibilidad horaria, asistencia a eventos, etc.Somos una empresa construida en torno a las personas que la forman, donde de forma cotidiana se escucha a todo el equipo para la toma de decisiones corporativas. Queremos construir y consolidar la mejor empresa posible y ser una referencia a nivel profesional, humano y ético… y nos encantaría contar contigo, ¿te apuntas?

Edelman is a voice synonymous with trust, reimagining a future where the currency of communication is action. Our culture thrives on three promises: boldness is possibility, empathy is progress, and curiosity is momentum.At Edelman, we understand diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging (DEIB) transform our colleagues, our company, our clients, and our communities. We are in relentless pursuit of an equitable and inspiring workplace that is respectful of all, reflects and represents the world in which we live, and fosters trust, collaboration and belonging.We currently seeking a Data Engineer with 3-5 years’ experience. The ideal candidate would have the ability to work independently within an AGILE working environment and have experience working with cloud infrastructure leveraging tools such as Apache Airflow, Databricks, and Snowflake. A familiarity with real-time data processing and AI implementation is advantageous.Why You'll Love Working with Us:At Edelman, we believe in fostering a collaborative and open environment where every team member’s voice is valued. Our data engineering team thrives on building robust, scalable, and efficient data systems to power insightful decision-making.We are at an exciting point in our journey, focusing on designing and implementing modern data pipelines, optimizing data workflows, and enabling seamless integration of data across platforms. You’ll work with best-in-class tools and practices for data ingestion, transformation, storage and analysis, ensuring high data quality, performance, and reliability.Our data stack leverages technologies like ETL/ELT pipelines, distributed computing frameworks, data lakes, and data warehouses to process and analyze data efficiently at scale. Additionally, we are exploring the use of Generative AI techniques to support tasks like *data enrichment and automated reporting, enhancing the insights we deliver to stakeholders.This role provides a unique opportunity to work on projects involving batch processing , streaming data pipelines, and automation of data workflows, with occasional opportunities to collaborate on AI-driven solutions.If you’re passionate about designing scalable systems, building reliable data infrastructure, and solving real-world data challenges, you’ll thrive here. We empower our engineers to explore new tools and approaches while delivering meaningful, high-quality solutions in a supportive, forward-thinking environment.Responsibilities:Design, build, and maintain scalable and robust data pipelines to support analytics and machine learning models, ensuring high data quality and reliability for both batch & real-time use cases.Design, maintain, optimize data models and data structures in tooling such as Snowflake and Databricks. Leverage Databricks and Cloud-native solutions for big data processing, ensuring efficient management of Spark jobs and seamless integration with other data services.Utilize PySpark and/or Ray to build and scale distributed computing tasks, enhancing the performance of machine learning model training and inference processes.Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve issues within data pipelines and infrastructure, implementing best practices for data engineering and continuous improvement.Diagrammatically document data engineering workflows. Collaborate with other Data Engineers, Product Owners, Software Developers and Machine Learning Engineers to implement new product features by understanding their needs and delivery timeously. Qualifications:Minimum of 3 years experience deploying enterprise level scalable data engineering solutions.Strong examples of independently developed data pipelines end-to-end, from problem formulation, raw data, to implementation, optimization, and result.Proven track record of building and managing scalable cloud-based infrastructure on AWS (incl. S3, Dynamo DB, EMR). Proven track record of implementing and managing of AI model lifecycle in a production environment.Experience using Apache Airflow (or equivalent) , Snowflake, Lucene-based search engines.Experience with Databricks (Delta format, Unity Catalog).Advanced SQL and Python knowledge with associated coding experience.Strong Experience with DevOps practices for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD).Experience wrangling structured & unstructured file formats (Parquet, CSV, JSON).Understanding and implementation of best practices within ETL end ELT processes.Data Quality best practice implementation using Great Expectations.Real-time data processing experience using Apache Kafka Experience (or equivalent) will be advantageous.Work independently with minimal supervision.Takes initiative and is action-focused.Mentor and share knowledge with junior team members.Collaborative with a strong ability to work in cross-functional teams.Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate with stakeholders across varying interest groups.Fluency in spoken and written English.€60,000 - €70,000 a yearAn employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, travel requirements, revenue-based metrics, any contractual agreements, and business or organizational needs. The range listed is just one component of DJEH’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, a Paid Time Off policy, and region-specific benefits.We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly align with every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

The Group: Morningstar’s Research group provides independent analysis on individual securities, managed investments, portfolios, and markets. The group also collects and maintains high-quality data on the equities, managed investments, and fixed-income investments we cover in our database, one of the largest investment databases in the world. Morningstar is one of the largest independent sources of manager, equity, and credit research in the world. We transform data into insights that investors can use to reach their financial goals.The Role: We are accepting recent graduates. While we look for individuals who have an interest in investing, your major is not as important as your ability to apply concepts to real-life scenarios. We welcome all fields of study. If you are selected for the program, you will be placed in a role that involves developing subject matter expertise on Morningstar data to support our clients and learning deep knowledge of Morningstar’s product and especially data landscape. The internship is designed to equip participants with the skills and knowledge to become future leaders at Morningstar. All positions are based in our Madrid office.Responsibilities:  Build deep expertise of Morningstar’s products, customer and especially data landscape. Gain experience in project management and provide input into the data process. Contribute to ongoing training sessions, stretch projects, and round-table discussions while developing a strong foundation of knowledge to build on and use in your Morningstar career. Develop critical skills and areas of expertise that will help prepare you for advancement into positions across the organization. Ensure high levels of data accuracy, completeness and coverage. Meet the predetermined production deadlines for internal and external clients.Requirements:  A bachelor’s degree. An outstanding academic record. Fluent/Native English and Portuguese speaker . Strong communication skills, both written and oral, together with good relationship-building skills. Creativity and strong analytical ability. Independent thinking and strong initiative. Excellent collaboration skills. Ability to adapt well to different situations and thrive in a challenging, fast-paced environment.Morningstar is an equal opportunity employer.302_MstarEurServSL Morningstar Europe Services, S.L. Legal EntityMorningstar’s hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. We’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, at least three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

Are you interested in joining a dynamic and international team of professionals to transform education? IE Universitys IT Department is looking for a AI Engineer to join its team! The Artificial Intelligence Engineer, preferably with a PhD and a strong track record in the development and implementation of advanced AI solutions. The ideal candidate will lead innovative projects, collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, and apply machine learning and deep learning techniques to solve complex challenges in various academic and research sectors. Proven experience in applying Large Language Models (LLM) and developing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques is absolutely mandatory, as well as advanced project management skills. Expertise in developing and deploying projects using LangChain or Directus for LLMs and RAG techniques is also required.Why IE University?With 50 years of experience and founded by and for entrepreneurs, IE University has turned business education on its head through disruptive teaching. We count on high-level faculty who bring real-world experience into the classroom and foster a hands-on approach to learning.Our PurposeAt IE University, we foster positive change through education, research, and innovation.As a transformative educational institution, we empower students to make their mark on the world. We provide them with the skills, knowledge and environment needed to make a difference, and they join a supportive and international community that lasts a lifetime.Our spirit of innovation and entrepreneurship has allowed us to drive change and constantly stay at the cutting edge of higher education. And through diversity, we have harnessed the power of people while also understanding and embracing the importance of humanities.Our PeopleAt IE we arePeople-drivenChange BuildersAutonomy EnthusiastsCommunication EnthusiastsKnowledge ChampionsWe are looking for a person to join a full-time position in Madrid. Your role as AI Engineer will involve Development of Advanced AI Models Design, train, and optimize deep learning models, including Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN), LSTM, Transformers, and GANs, applied to areas such as computer vision, natural language processing, and recommendation systems. Implementation of LLM and RAG Techniques Develop and integrate Large Language Models and apply Retrieval-Augmented Generation techniques to enhance the accuracy and relevance of AI solutions in academic and research projects. AI Project Management Lead AI projects from conception to implementation, coordinating multidisciplinary teams, managing resources, and ensuring objectives and deadlines are met. Integration of AI Solutions Collaborate with engineering and academic teams to implement AI solutions into existing systems and services, ensuring scalability, efficiency, and alignment with institutional goals. Research and Development Stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in artificial intelligence, proposing and developing new techniques and tools that add value to the university and its research projects. Optimization and Scalability Adjust hyperparameters, refine neural network architectures, and optimize data pipelines, ensuring efficient use of computational resources (GPUs/TPUs) and leveraging cloud infrastructures (AWS, Azure, GCP) for horizontal and vertical scalability. To thrive in this role, you should have Educational Background PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related fields. Professional Experience Over 4 years of demonstrable experience in developing and implementing AI and deep learning solutions, with a strong track record in Deep Learning projects. Technical Skills Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and R. Experience with AI frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras. Knowledge of MLOps, best deployment practices, and pipeline management tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow). Experience handling big data and distributed ecosystem tools (Apache Spark, Hadoop) and knowledge of NoSQL databases. Specialization in LLM and RAG Proven experience in developing and applying Large Language Models and Retrieval-Augmented Generation techniques, including the use of LangChain or Directus. Project Management Advanced skills in planning, executing, and overseeing AI projects, including team coordination and resource management. Cloud Infrastructure Experience working with cloud infrastructures (AWS, Azure, GCP) and utilizing GPU/TPU environments for training and optimization. Languages Advanced English proficiency (C2 level), both written and spoken. Preferred QualificationsSpecialized AI Areas Experience with advanced techniques in natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, recommendation systems, and/or reinforcement learning. Publications and Contributions Publications in recognized AI conferences or journals, and/or contributions to open-source projects or active participation in AI communities. DevOps and Containerization Knowledge of DevOps and containerization tools such as Docker and Kubernetes. It’s time to bring your best and make your mark. Now the choice is yours!If you want to be part of this educational revolution, we invite you to apply and be part of our amazing team at IE University.

About TemenosTemenos powers a world of banking that creates opportunities for billions of people and businesses everywhere. We have been doing this for over 30 years through the pioneering spirit of our Temenosians who are passionate about making banking better, together.We serve over 3000 clients from the largest to challengers and community banks in 150+ countries. We collaborate with clients to build new banking services and state-of-the-art customer experiences on our open banking platform, helping them operate more sustainably.At Temenos, we have an open-minded and inclusive culture, where everyone has the power to create their own destiny and make a positive contribution to the world of banking and society. THE ROLE The Manager – Global Revenue Analytics role reports into Global Revenue Operations Lead. This role will lead a team of regional & global analysts to deliver operational analytics and reporting for the CRO organization. The revenue analytics team is expected to provide analytical & technical reporting capability, actionable insights & storytelling, leading indicator & predictive reporting, cross-functional collaboration & execution, and stakeholder communication. OPPORTUNITIES  Y ou will lead and establish a world-class team of analysts with a service-oriented leadership style.  You will be a collaborative member of the global revenue operations team and accountable for the CRO organization analytics & reporting function.  You will act as an individual contributor on strategic reporting with comfort delivering off-cycle reporting for CRO & Revenue Operations leadership.  You will establish reporting best practice and standards to ensure accurate, timely, and consistent reporting and measurement of sales metrics. Metrics include pipeline creation & management, sales activities, forecasting, coverage, and sales productivity & attainment, among others.  You will effectively communicate actionable and insightful information & recommendations to global & regional stakeholders and business partners (“tell a story” with the data).  You will utilize analytics & AI capabilities to identify leading indicators of risk or opportunity against sales & pipeline goals.  You will enable the revenue analytics team to support global & regional short-term, mid-term, and long-term revenue cadences by creating & maintaining dashboards and reporting tailored to all distinct revenue cadence moment.  You will develop a comprehensive understanding of the global business strategy and data structure, as well as connected people, processes, and systems, to be able to deliver ad-hoc reporting needs.  You will serve as a global expert of key performance indicator trends, actuals, and benchmarks through data analysis and conversing with business partners. Use this information to guide regional analyst direction & priorities, as well as encourage internal stakeholders to improve against benchmarks.  You will partner with team members of the data foundation, finance, FP&A, and IT teams.  You will serve both direct and indirect business partners with commitment, care, collaboration, and challenging the status-quo. Skills Y ou should have excellent leadership capabilities, with experience in building and developing high-performing teams through a defined leadership philosophy.  You should have clear communication and excellent interpersonal skills (both written and verbal) with a willingness to serve stakeholders and your direct reports.  You should have strong prioritization and project management skills leveraged to effectively manage limited resources within the team to focus on highest impact projects while meeting recurring objectives.  You should have strategic thinker with a track record of driving results against objectives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.  You should have top-tier quantitative analytical skills, with the ability to analyze complex data sets and derive actionable insights.  You should have the ability to “tell a story” by communicating complex data insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, with demonstrated experience presenting & recommending to executive leadership.  You should have strong understanding of SaaS & Subscription business models and go-to-market strategies. Experience in the B2B software industry and reporting on software industry standard license and SaaS metrics.  You should have proficiency in Salesforce.com, Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint, and experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.  You should have experience with revenue intelligence & sales engagement platforms, such as Clari and Groove.  You should be comfort & familiarity with learning and leveraging AI capabilities in the revenue space.  You should have experience in a revenue operations or business analytics reporting or data analysis role.  You should have experience directly managing a team.  You should have a bachelor’s degree in data science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field is preferred.  VALUES  Care about helping our clients succeed.  Commit to providing the highest level of support to your region.  Collaborate with peers and partners.  Challenge the status quo.  SOME OF OUR BENEFITS include:  Maternity leave: Transition back with 3 days per week in the first month and 4 days per week in the second month  Civil Partnership: 1 week of paid leave if you're getting married. This covers marriages and civil partnerships, including same sex/civil partnership  Family care: 4 weeks of paid family care leave  Recharge days: 4 days per year to use when you need to physically or mentally needed to recharge  Study leave: 2 weeks of paid leave each year for study or personal development Temenos is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please let us know.Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy

titulo_oferta: Security Insight Data Engineer (Hybrid set up)
descripcion: We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Engineer with a DevOps background to join our Security Insights Team., You will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure that supports data analysis and reporting activities. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with data scientists, analysts, and other team members to ensure smooth data operations, optimize data pipelines, and facilitate the delivery of useful insights.Join our team of cybersecurity professionals and help Swiss Re to fulfil its mission in making the world more resilient.About The TeamThe Security Team is the focal point for all security activities across Swiss Re. We are responsible for cybersecurity engineering and operations, governance, risk and compliance. We define, monitor and advance the company's security strategy. We are looking for a self-starter who is happy to challenge the status quo of existing processes – aiming towards improving their efficiency and developing the solutions supporting them.As part of the Security Insights team, you will be responsible for enabling the Security team to make data driven decisions, by providing dashboards and insights.In your role, you will… Build and manage robust data infrastructure, including data storage, processing, transformation, and visualization tools, using the Azure cloud-based platform and related technologies (such as Terraform)Implement and maintain CI/CD practices for data applications and infrastructure, automating deployment, testing, and monitoring processesCollaborate with data analysts, and business stakeholders to understand their requirements and provide technical support to enable seamless data access, transformation, and analysisOptimize data processing and ETL workflows, continuously monitoring and improving their performance, reliability, and scalabilityEnsure data security and quality standards are upheld throughout the data lifecycle, implementing appropriate data governance processes and best practicesYour QualificationsNobody is perfect and meets 100% of our requirements. If you, however, meet some of the criteria below and are curious about the world of cyber security and data insights, we'll be more than happy to meet you!What We Need From YouExperience with data engineering frameworks (e.g., Synapse, Databricks, Apache Spark, Hadoop).Experience with automation tools and technologies such as Terraform Experience with relational databases (e.g., SQL server, Oracle, SQL, MySQL) Proficiency in any programming language, examples include SQL, Python, PowerShell, C#, and RExperience with CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Azure Dev-ops, Jenkins or GitLab Good communication skills in spoken and written English Nice-to-haveUnderstanding of technologies related to information security, vulnerability management, and Identity & Access Management Relevant work experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role Experience with other cloud platforms such as AWS and GCP Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies RoleFor Spain the base salary range for this position is between [EUR 41,000] and [EUR 69,000] per year (for a full-time role). The specific salary offered considers: the requirements, scope, complexity and responsibilities of the role, the applicant’s own profile including education/qualifications, expertise, specialization, skills and experience.In the situation where you do not meet all the requirements or you significantly exceed these, the offered salary may be below or above the advertised range.In addition to your base salary, you may be eligible for additional rewards and benefits including an attractive performance-based bonus.About Swiss ReSwiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.KeywordsReference Code: 132476

Job Description & SummaryEn PwC, trabajamos con algunas de las compañías más grandes y complejas del mundo para comprender sus problemas y oportunidades comerciales únicas en un entorno en constante cambio.Por ello, buscamos un profesional con conocimiento y experiencia en el ámbito de la Consultoría y/o Auditoría para incorporarse al departamento de Sector Público en la oficina de Madrid. En este contexto, la persona se incorporará al equipo para trabajar en proyectos relacionados con el soporte y asesoramiento a la Administración Pública en relación con las actuaciones de comprobación de las justificaciones de la actividad subvencionada asociada al programa Kit Digital.Asimismo, podrá participar en otros proyectos de consultoría con el objetivo de ofrecer asesoramiento y soluciones innovadoras en diversos ámbitos tanto a la Administración Pública como a otras entidades y agentes que componen el tejido económico-empresarial del sector público.Las habilidades y responsabilidades profesionales que deberás demostrar para este puesto son, con carácter orientativo, las siguientes:Pensamiento crítico y capacidad de ordenar problemas no estructuradosAptitud para la resolución de problemas de forma eficaz y eficienteAutonomía, capacidad para trabajar en equipo y rigor técnicoUtilizar la comunicación de manera directa y fluida con el cliente para fomentar el desarrollo de un asesoramiento y acompañamiento personalizado y con foco en las necesidades específicas del clienteHabilidades en gestión de proyectos, gestión de equipos y liderazgoTrabajar de manera eficiente en entornos multidisciplinares y colaborativos con gran orientación al clienteProactividad y adaptabilidadCapacidad para ofrecer soluciones innovadoras, sostenibles y aplicables a la realidad de cada organización y que marquen la diferencia en la resolución de los desafíos a los que se enfrenta cada sector en concretoCompetencia en la búsqueda de oportunidades y sinergias que integren situaciones, entornos y perspectivas diferentes¿Qué requisitos debes cumplir?:Contar con una titulación de entre las siguientes: Administración y Dirección de Empresas (se valora si es con especialidad en Business Analytics, Tecnología o similar)Ingeniería Industrial, Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Aeroespacial, Organización Industrial...Liderazgo Emprendedor e Innovación (LEINN)Dobles Grados como ADE + Derecho, ADE + Ingeniería, etc. Contar con más de 2 años de experiencia demostrable en proyectos de consultoría de negocio y/ o AuditoríaConocimientos tecnológicos básicos (paquete de Microsoft Office, Power BI...)Dominio del inglés (nivel mínimo demostrable C1)¿Qué aspectos adicionales valoramos?Conocimiento del Sector PúblicoHaber trabajado en proyectos de auditorías de subvenciones Conocimiento en Estrategia y CompetitividadValorable el dominio o conocimiento de otros idiomasUtilización de herramientas de reporting y seguimiento, como Power BI.¿Qué actividades realizarías?Evaluación de cumplimiento y transparencia: Analizar el uso de fondos públicos y asegurar que las subvenciones otorgadas cumplen con las normativas y regulaciones vigentes.Revisión documental y evidencial: Examinar y verificar documentación para evaluar el cumplimiento de condiciones establecidas en los acuerdos de subvención, asegurando que la documentación respalde el uso de fondos conforme a los objetivos.Análisis de riesgos: Identificar riesgos potenciales en la ejecución de subvenciones y desarrollar recomendaciones para mitigarlos, mejorando así la eficiencia y transparencia en la administración de recursos.Entrevistas y recopilación de datos: Realizar entrevistas y coordinar la recopilación de datos necesarios para la auditoría, interactuando con stakeholders clave para obtener información crítica.Informes y recomendaciones: Redactar informes detallados con hallazgos y recomendaciones, presentando los resultados a equipos de auditoría y líderes de la organización para una mejora de procesos y cumplimiento normativo.Soporte en la implementación de mejoras: Asesorar a los equipos en la implementación de mejoras y mejores prácticas de control interno, basadas en los hallazgos de la auditoría.Asesoramiento a cliente en la optimización de procesos de negocio y mejora de resultadosApoyo al gerente en la gestión del proyecto (planteamiento, dimensionamiento, organización y control de calidad y verificación de la ejecución de los proyectos), así como gestión y coordinación de agentes y equipos multidisciplinares de trabajo¡Te esperamos!

Oferta Junior Business Developer en Madrid Descripción De La EmpresaImportrust permite a los clientes en Portugal y España comprar automóviles de cualquier concesionario en Europa, mediante un proceso totalmente seguro, sin complicaciones y llave en mano. Nos aseguramos de encontrar las mejores ofertas y ahorrarle dinero en el coche de sus sueños.Somos líderes del mercado en Portugal, y uno de los principales plater en España con más de 1.300 automóviles vendidos en 2024.Descripción Del PuestoComo Junior Business Developer (jBD), formarás parte esencial de nuestro equipo, guiando a nuestros clientes a lo largo del proceso de compra de su vehículo y asegurando una experiencia fluida y satisfactoria. Tu contribución será clave para impulsar la expansión de nuestras operaciones en el dinámico mercado automotriz español.Como Junior Business Developer (jBD), adquirirás experiencia práctica en ventas, atención al cliente y procesos de importación de vehículos, desarrollando habilidades fundamentales para una carrera en la industria automotriz.🗣️ Idiomas Requeridos: Español + Inglés🌍 Localización: Madrid, España📅 Fecha de inicio: ASAPQue significa ser un JBD en Importrust? Explorar y aprender: Adquirirás un conocimiento profundo de la importación de automóviles y los marcos legales en España.Soporte al equipo de ventas: Colaborarás con nuestros Business Developers para garantizar la mejor experiencia para nuestros clientes.Contacto con clientes: Ayudarás en la identificación de nuevas oportunidades, estableciendo relaciones sólidas y fidelizando clientes.Gestión documental: Participarás en la supervisión del proceso de compra, asegurando que toda la documentación necesaria esté en orden🍀 El Candidato IdealEstás estudiando o recién graduado en Administración de Empresas, Marketing, Comercio Internacional o áreas relacionadas.Te apasiona el sector automotriz y quieres aprender más sobre él.Cuentas con habilidades de comunicación y organización.Idiomas: Nivel alto de español e inglés.¡Actitud proactiva y ganas de aprender!🚘 ¿Qué ofrecemos?Formación en una empresa innovadora del sector automotriz.Participación en proyectos reales que impactan directamente en el negocio.Ambiente dinámico y colaborativo.Posibilidad de incorporación tras el período de prácticas.Oficina ubicada en el centro de Madrid.🧑🔧 Proceso De ContrataciónRonda 1: 45 minutos - Carlos Ron, Country Manager de Importrust España - Te entrevistará primero para conocernos y contarnos tu experiencia. Ronda 2: 45 minutos - Caso Práctico - Simularemos una compra para un cliente y comentaremos cómo abordarías el desafío de comprar un automóvil y tu conocimiento técnico sobre el proceso. Ronda 3: 45 minutos - António Eça, Cofundador y Director General de Importrust: Interacción con la dirección y conversación sobre la visión de la empresa y tu papel en ella.Lo Que Hace Único a Importrust🔎 Visión: Queremos ser el facilitador de la compra de cualquier vehículo en Europa, y España es el primer paso hacia nuestro objetivo internacional.💪 Misión: Ser el socio de nuestros clientes al realizar la segunda compra más importante de sus vidas.🔑 Principales Métricas De La Empresa14.000 clientes potenciales generadosMás de 1000 automóviles vendidos en 2024Crecimiento promedio del 150% (3 últimos años)45 M€ en volumen bruto de ventas Ahorros para los clientes: +6M€Calificación de 4.9/5.0 en 450 reseñas en Google📰 Lee Más Sobre ImportrustOfficial web pageTiktokInstagramNote: This is a unpaid internship.Skills: organización,comunicación,atención al cliente,idiomas: español e inglés,communication,importación de vehículos,ventas,sales,organization

¿Estás preparadx para un cambio y explotar tus habilidades como nunca? 👉🏼 Sigue leyendo porque tenemos lo que buscas… 🛸 ¿Quiénes somos?  🛸Somos una empresa internacional con más de 16 años de experiencia en consultoría e ingeniería informática.Con más de 3000 Primers operando en 4 sectores principales en todo el mundo: IT, Telecomunicaciones, Infraestructuras y Energía.Nos puedes encontrar en más de 50 ciudades en todo el mundo:ESPAÑA | PORTUGAL | FRANCIA | REINO UNIDO | ITALIA | SUIZA | POLONIA | BRASIL 🕵🏽♂️ ¿Qué buscamos? 🕵🏽♂️Al menos 2 años de experiencia en desarrollos sobre plataforma Moodle.Experiencia con tecnologías PHP, HTML, CSS y Javascript.Conocimientos en bases de datos relacionales: MySQL.Capacidad de gestión de proyectos y documentación de procedimientos y especificaciones funcionales.Nivel de Inglés B2 o superior.🚀 ¿Qué ofrecemos? 🚀Podemos asegurarte que contamos con el mejor equipo de todo el sector. Y a todo esto súmale transparencia total en todos los pasos. ¿Quienes somos?Somos una consultora referente en el mundo de la transformación digital. Trabajamos en proyectos end to end con nuestros clientes, desde que surge una necesidad hasta todo el desarrollo y la implementación de los mismos. Nos gusta entender a fondo el reto de cada proyecto y, con todo el talento que tenemos en casa, nos aseguramos de llevarlo a cabo con éxito.El área de Data & MarketingDesde Data Marketing, estamos buscando al mejor talento para incorporarse a nuestro equipo. Requisitos imprescindibles:Amplio conocimiento de tecnologías web front-end (HTML5, CSS, JavaScript).Dominio probado de plataformas de testing como AB Tasty, Optimizely, VWO, Adobe Target, Dynamic Yield y similares.Comprensión de herramientas de análisis de datos cuantitativos, tales como Google Analytics 4 y Adobe Analytics.Familiaridad con herramientas de análisis cualitativo, por ejemplo, Hotjar, Crazyegg o ContentSquare.Se valorarán especialmente las siguientes aptitudes y conocimientos:Experiencia en la gestión de etiquetas mediante plataformas como Google Tag Manager o Tealium.Minuciosidad y atención al detalle.Capacidad para colaborar eficazmente en equipo, contribuyendo a la consecución de objetivos comunes.Proactividad, interés por la innovación y las nuevas tendencias en el ámbito digital, junto con un criterio sólido para su aplicación práctica.Conocimiento del entorno digital y sus posibilidades. ¿Quienes somos? Somos una consultora referente en el mundo de la transformación digital. Trabajamos en proyectos end to end con nuestros clientes, desde que surge una necesidad hasta todo el desarrollo y la implementación de los mismos. Nos gusta entender a fondo el reto de cada proyecto y, con todo el talento que tenemos en casa, nos aseguramos de llevarlo a cabo con éxito.El área de Data & MarketingDesde Data & Marketing, estamos buscando al mejor talento para incorporarse a nuestro equipo. En este área trabajamos más de 200 profesionales, abarcando todas las capacidades técnicas que engloban el mundo del dato y de marketing. Somos un área de pleno crecimiento y con grandes retos por delante.¿Por qué estamos creciendo tanto? Nos destacamos en el mercado por nuestro enfoque integral, mezclando disciplinas técnicas muy diversas para llegar a aportar soluciones con impacto real.Tomamos decisiones estratégicas basadas en datos, siempre centrados en el “para qué” y no solo en el “cómo”. Trabajamos habitualmente en entornos internacionales, y estamos preparados para escalar.Como partners del año de Salesforce, estamos a la vanguardia de la tecnología y ofrecemos las soluciones más innovadoras a nuestros clientes.Contamos con la ventaja de ser parte del grupo WPP, lo que nos aporta grandes sinergias en proyectos de Data & Marketing.ç¿Quieres ser parte de este crecimiento? Esto es lo que buscamos:¿Te apasionan los datos y cómo transformarlos en soluciones innovadoras? 🧠📊 Estamos buscando un Data Scientist creativo y orientado a resultados para unirse a nuestro equipo. En este rol, tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar con grandes volúmenes de datos, descubrir patrones clave y aportar insights valiosos que impulsarán nuestras decisiones estratégicas.Si disfrutas resolver problemas complejos, experimentar con algoritmos avanzados y convertir números en historias, ¡queremos conocerte! 🚀ResponsabilidadesTrabajamos en entorno cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) y usamos las herramientas adecuadas para cada problema en concreto.Traducir las necesidades de negocio a modelos predictivos, su dimensionamiento y productivización, así como la activación y monitorización de estas predicciones en relación a los OKRs.Desarollar modelos matemáticos avanzados basados en técnicas de machine learning, especialmente en modelos predictivos de clasificación (i.e., bagging, boosting) y clusterización (i.e., K-means, Mean Shift).Requisitos:Experiencia de al menos 3 años en las funciones descritas.Tener conocimientos de desarrollo de software, Object Oriented Programing, y manejo avanzado de Python: estructuras de datos y principales librerías (i.e., numpy, pandas, sklearn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch).Conocimientos de bases de datos relacionales y fuentes no relacionales/NoSQL.Experiencia en metodología DevOps, contribución a repositorios git, monitorización del código mediante builds (docker) y testing, así como despliegues en entornos de UAT y productivos.Experiencia en metodología MLOps, paquetización de modelos, módulos de entrenamiento y validación, módulos de inferencia, versionamiento de modelos y monitorización de data shift para el re-entrenamiento.Nivel alto de inglés.Nos encantaría si:Estás acostumbrado a trabajar con algunos de los siguientes paradigmas: series temporales, NLP, análisis geoespacial, reconocimiento de imágenes, etc.Tienes conocimientos sobre técnicas de optimización numérica: gradient descent, quasi-Newton, computación evolutiva, programación lineal, etc.Has trabajado con soluciones cloud orientadas a Inteligencia Artificial: GCP (Vertex), AWS (Amazon SageMaker), Azure (MLFlow). Y la realización de prototipos/productos web en frameworks ágiles.Tienes experiencia con entornos Big Data y haber tratado volúmenes de datos que requieran entornos distribuidos (pyspark y Databricks).Que poseas conocimientos en herramientas de visualización: Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense, Shiny, Spotfire, etc.Beneficios de trabajar en The CocktailFlexibilidad horaria25 días de vacaciones al año + nochebuena y nochevieja Modelo híbrido, full remote o presencial.Plan de carrera personalizado y formación continuaMejora tu nivel de inglés con clases formativasNo tenemos dress code. Senior Data EngineerEn Selectra…buscamos personas valientes, dinámicas y listas para afrontar la velocidad del mundo. Queremos profesionales capaces de entender los retos digitales, traducirlos en soluciones ágiles y potenciar su impacto en nuestros proyectos.Estamos comprometidos con el desarrollo de nuestro talento, formando a quienes tienen el potencial de convertirse en los futuros líderes de nuestras áreas clave: ventas, desarrollo de negocio, marketing y tecnología.Tu misión:¿Eres una persona apasionado/a por el análisis de datos y la tecnología? ¿Te gustaría aprender a construir, mantener y optimizar la infraestructura de datos de Selectra? ¿Te gustaría trabajar en proyectos variados que impulsen la toma de decisiones basada en datos que ayuden al crecimiento y correcto funcionamiento de la empresa?¿Qué harás?Diseñar y desarrollar arquitecturas de datos escalables y seguras.Extraer, transformar y cargar datos de diversas fuentes.Proporcionar soporte técnico y resolver problemas relacionados con la infraestructura de datos.Monitorizar y optimizar el rendimiento de los sistemas de datos.Gestión y Optimización de Bases de Datos.Análisis y Visualización de Datos.Colaborar con analistas de datos para entender y abordar sus necesidades de datos.Mantenimiento y disponibilidad de las fuentes de datos para el uso de los mismos por analistas.Documentar y mantener la documentación de los sistemas de datos.Cumplir con las normas y regulaciones de privacidad de datos.¿Qué buscamos en ti?Soft SkillsCapacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo.Perfil analítico, resolutivo y orientado a objetivos.Hard SkillsGrado en Ingeniería o equivalente.Experiencia de 4/5 años en el diseño y desarrollo de sistemas de datos.Conocimiento de lenguajes de programación como Python, SQL y Java .Conocimiento de bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales.Familiaridad con plataformas de computación en la nube,especialmente, Google Cloud Platform.¿Qué te ofrecemos?Contrato IndefinidoVentajas y beneficios exclusivos para empleados/asFormación continuaTrabajo 100% presencial con oficina en el Centro de Madrid¿Por qué Selectra?La visión de Selectra es que nadie tenga que preocuparse por los gastos de su hogar o negocio. Para ello, solucionamos la gestión de estos gastos - como luz, gas, internet, telefonía, seguros o alarmas - ahorrando al cliente tiempo y dinero.Somos una multinacional con presencia en 22 países y estamos centrados en las personas. En apenas 8 años hemos conseguido ser el comparador nº 1 de luz y gas y ahorrar a nuestros clientes 71,6 millones de euros en 2023 en España, Portugal y México y LATAM… ¿La clave de nuestro liderazgo? Nuestro equipo. Todos con el mismo objetivo: simplificar la vida de las personas.Nuestro ADNWe make it BIG. Somos ambiciosos, enérgicos e inconformistasWe make it EASY. Somos constructivos, amables y empáticosWe make it YOURS. Somos implicados, responsables y exigentesWe make it HAPPEN. Somos proactivos, humildes y resolutivosWe make it TOGETHER. Somos serviciales, cooperativos y un equipoY tú, ¿te sumas al reto?
